rows.story_text:
This is Cat.

This is Dog.

story_text.eng:
This is Cat.

This is Dog.

annotation_1.eng: Count the animals together and describe their colors.

annotation_2.eng: Which one has shorter ears? Which one has longer ears?

annotation_3.eng: Which one has short whiskers? Which one has long whiskers?

rows.annotation_1: Count the animals together and describe their colors.
rows.annotation_2: Which one has shorter ears? Which one has longer ears?
rows.annotation_3: Which one has short whiskers? Which one has long whiskers?

rows.story_text:
It is night. It is dark.

It is cold. It is very cold.

story_text.eng:
It is night. It is dark.

It is cold. It is very cold.

annotation_1.eng: Their house is round. Do you live in a round building?

annotation_3.eng: A full moon forms a complete circle. A moon that is a partial circle like this is called a crescent moon.

rows.annotation_1: Their house is round. Do you live in a round building?
rows.annotation_3: A full moon forms a complete circle. A moon that is a partial circle like this is called a crescent moon.

rows.story_text: For Dog it is too cold.

story_text.eng: For Dog it is too cold.

annotation_1.eng: What shows you that Dog is cold?

annotation_2.eng: A light blue color is often used to show something cold. Does seeing blue make you feel cold?

annotation_3.eng: On cold nights, even outdoor animals can use help with the cold.

rows.annotation_1: What shows you that Dog is cold?
rows.annotation_2: A light blue color is often used to show something cold. Does seeing blue make you feel cold?
rows.annotation_3: On cold nights, even outdoor animals can use help with the cold.

rows.story_text:
Cat gives Dog underwear.

One pair of underwear is dirty. One pair of underwear is clean.

story_text.eng:
Cat gives Dog underwear.

One pair of underwear is dirty. One pair of underwear is clean.

annotation_1.eng: Is this choice of underwear very helpful?

annotation_2.eng: Is it silly that Cat offers underwear that is dirty?

rows.annotation_1: Is this choice of underwear very helpful?
rows.annotation_2: Is it silly that Cat offers underwear that is dirty?

rows.story_text: Dog takes the clean underwear. But it is still too cold.

story_text.eng: Dog takes the clean underwear. But it is still too cold.

annotation_1.eng: Count together how much clothing Dog has. Dog is cold and needs more.

annotation_2.eng: Remember a time when you were cold and how hard it was to get warm.

annotation_3.eng: Why are Dog's arms crossed in front?

rows.annotation_1: Count together how much clothing Dog has. Dog is cold and needs more.
rows.annotation_2: Remember a time when you were cold and how hard it was to get warm.
rows.annotation_3: Why are Dog's arms crossed in front?

rows.story_text: Cat gives Dog shirts. One shirt is big. One shirt is small.

story_text.eng: Cat gives Dog shirts. One shirt is big. One shirt is small.

annotation_1.eng: Is offering a shirt that is much too small helpful?

annotation_2.eng: Is Cat trying to help, or is Cat just having some fun?

annotation_3.eng: Which of Cat's paws has more visible claws?

rows.annotation_1: Is offering a shirt that is much too small helpful?
rows.annotation_2: Is Cat trying to help, or is Cat just having some fun?
rows.annotation_3: Which of Cat's paws has more visible claws?

rows.story_text: Dog takes the big shirt. But it is still too cold.

story_text.eng: Dog takes the big shirt. But it is still too cold.

annotation_1.eng: Count the pieces of clothing Dog has. Is it enough?

annotation_2.eng: A square is a shape like a piece of paper with four equal sides. Compare the round moon with the square window.

annotation_3.eng: Have you ever seen a round window?

rows.annotation_1: Count the pieces of clothing Dog has. Is it enough?
rows.annotation_2: A square is a shape like a piece of paper with four equal sides. Compare the round moon with the square window.
rows.annotation_3: Have you ever seen a round window?

rows.story_text:
Cat gives Dog pants.

One pair of pants is long. One pair of pants is short.

story_text.eng:
Cat gives Dog pants.

One pair of pants is long. One pair of pants is short.

annotation_1.eng: How many pieces of clothing does Cat offer each time?

annotation_2.eng: When you are cold, do you want to wear shorts?

annotation_3.eng: What will happen with Dog's tail? Do these pants have a hole for Dog's tail?

rows.annotation_1: How many pieces of clothing does Cat offer each time?
rows.annotation_2: When you are cold, do you want to wear shorts?
rows.annotation_3: What will happen with Dog's tail? Do these pants have a hole for Dog's tail?

rows.story_text: Dog takes the long pair of pants. But it is still too cold.

story_text.eng: Dog takes the long pair of pants. But it is still too cold.

annotation_1.eng: Each time, Dog gets one more piece of clothing. How many pieces does Dog have on now?

annotation_2.eng: How many pieces will Dog need?

annotation_3.eng: Do you think there is any way Dog will get warm?

rows.annotation_1: Each time, Dog gets one more piece of clothing. How many pieces does Dog have on now?
rows.annotation_2: How many pieces will Dog need?
rows.annotation_3: Do you think there is any way Dog will get warm?

rows.story_text:
Cat gives Dog vests. One vest is wet, one vest is dry.

Dog takes the dry vest, but it is still too cold.

story_text.eng:
Cat gives Dog vests. One vest is wet, one vest is dry.

Dog takes the dry vest, but it is still too cold.

annotation_1.eng: Does having something wet on make you feel warmer or colder?

annotation_2.eng: Dog had three pieces of clothing on. The vest is one more. How many does that make?

annotation_3.eng: With the vest, Dog has four pieces of clothing. Before he put the vest on, he had one less. How many was that?

rows.annotation_1: Does having something wet on make you feel warmer or colder?
rows.annotation_2: Dog had three pieces of clothing on. The vest is one more. How many does that make?
rows.annotation_3: With the vest, Dog has four pieces of clothing. Before he put the vest on, he had one less. How many was that?

rows.story_text:
Cat gives Dog jackets. One jacket is thick, one jacket is thin.

Dog takes the thick jacket, but it is still too cold.

story_text.eng:
Cat gives Dog jackets. One jacket is thick, one jacket is thin.

Dog takes the thick jacket, but it is still too cold.

annotation_1.eng: Thicker clothing helps you keep heat in and stay warmer.

annotation_2.eng: Does the color of the jacket look odd with Dog's other clothes?

annotation_3.eng: Dog now has one more than four. How many is that?

rows.annotation_1: Thicker clothing helps you keep heat in and stay warmer.
rows.annotation_2: Does the color of the jacket look odd with Dog's other clothes?
rows.annotation_3: Dog now has one more than four. How many is that?

rows.story_text:
Cat gives Dog hats. One hat is high, one hat is low.

Dog takes the high hat, but it is still too cold.

story_text.eng:
Cat gives Dog hats. One hat is high, one hat is low.

Dog takes the high hat, but it is still too cold.

annotation_1.eng: Point at the short hat and the tall hat.

annotation_2.eng: Does it matter which hat Dog chooses? Is one hat warmer than the other?

annotation_3.eng: Do you have any hats? If so, do you like to wear them?

rows.annotation_1: Point at the short hat and the tall hat.
rows.annotation_2: Does it matter which hat Dog chooses? Is one hat warmer than the other?
rows.annotation_3: Do you have any hats? If so, do you like to wear them?

rows.story_text:
Cat gives Dog shoes.

One pair of shoes is new, one pair of shoes is old.

story_text.eng:
Cat gives Dog shoes.

One pair of shoes is new, one pair of shoes is old.

annotation_1.eng: To give someone a choice, how many things do you need? Would having one thing be enough for a choice?

annotation_2.eng: A person can be baffled if you give them too many things to choose from.

annotation_3.eng: Dog is still cold. Why are Dog's choices not helping?

rows.annotation_1: To give someone a choice, how many things do you need? Would having one thing be enough for a choice?
rows.annotation_2: A person can be baffled if you give them too many things to choose from.
rows.annotation_3: Dog is still cold. Why are Dog's choices not helping?

rows.story_text:
Dogs takes the new shoes, and then ...

It is not too cold for Dog.

story_text.eng:
Dogs takes the new shoes, and then ...

It is not too cold for Dog.

annotation_2.eng: Why isn't Dog cold any more? Did his clothes help make him warm?

annotation_3.eng: Where is the moon and what is that on the horizon in the window?

rows.annotation_2: Why isn't Dog cold any more? Did his clothes help make him warm?
rows.annotation_3: Where is the moon and what is that on the horizon in the window?

rows.story_text:
The night is over.

The moon goes. The sun comes.

story_text.eng:
The night is over.

The moon goes. The sun comes.

annotation_2.eng: Point at the round, yellow sun. Is the moon always gone when the sun comes up?

annotation_3.eng: Is the moon always visible at night?

rows.annotation_2: Point at the round, yellow sun. Is the moon always gone when the sun comes up?
rows.annotation_3: Is the moon always visible at night?

rows.story_text:
It is day. It is light. It is warm. It is very warm.

For Dog it is too warm.

story_text.eng:
It is day. It is light. It is warm. It is very warm.

For Dog it is too warm.

annotation_1.eng: List all the pieces of clothing Dog has on.

annotation_2.eng: What is Dog doing with his right hand? What motion do you use to try to cool off?

annotation_3.eng: Are Dog's clothes finally making him warm, or too warm?

rows.annotation_1: List all the pieces of clothing Dog has on.
rows.annotation_2: What is Dog doing with his right hand? What motion do you use to try to cool off?
rows.annotation_3: Are Dog's clothes finally making him warm, or too warm?

rows.story_text:
Bye bye Cat.

Bye bye hot Dog.

story_text.eng:
Bye bye Cat.

Bye bye hot Dog.

annotation_1.eng: Count Cat's whiskers. How many whiskers does Dog have?

annotation_2.eng: Who has more whiskers -- Cat or Dog? They have the same number, but Dog's whiskers are small.

annotation_3.eng: In the end, how many pieces of clothing does Dog have? Too many!

rows.annotation_1: Count Cat's whiskers. How many whiskers does Dog have?
rows.annotation_2: Who has more whiskers -- Cat or Dog? They have the same number, but Dog's whiskers are small.
rows.annotation_3: In the end, how many pieces of clothing does Dog have? Too many!
